title: E field and isoline map - where does electron go

content.prompt: Which of the following correctly indicates the resulting motion of the electron and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: The electron will move toward the VC equipotential because electrons move toward stronger electric fields.
The electron will move toward the VC equipotential because electrons experience an electric force in the direction of the electric field.
The electron will move toward the VA equipotential because electrons move toward lower electric potentials.
The electron will move toward the VA equipotential because electrons always accelerate toward higher potential.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
